Player History
Drafted in 3rd round, 42nd overall pick, by New York (A) in 1971...
Released by New York (A) on 4/1/1971...
Signed as a free agent by Chicago (N) on 4/1/1971 to a minor league deal...
Injured on 6/29/1973 with a Sore Elbow, out for 1-2 weeks...
Had first career hit (double) on 5/14/1976, off Chuck Nieson (ATL)...
Injured on 6/2/1980 with a Stiff Shoulder, out for one week...
Hit first career homerun on 7/24/1982, off Steve Busby (PIT)...
Had 5 hits with 2 RBI against Houston on 8/7/1982...
Injured on 4/23/1983 with a Strained Calf Muscle, out for 2 weeks...
Traded from Chicago (N) to New York (N) on 7/7/1983 (Going to CHC: 1B C. Fisk. Going to NYM: 2B J. Remy)...
Won World Series with New York (N) in 1983...
